The 'English Channel' (, , ), often referred to simply as the 'Channel', is an
arm of the Atlantic Ocean that separates southern England from northern France,
and joins the North Sea to the Atlantic. It is about long and varies in width
from at its widest to in the Strait of Dover. "English
Channel". The Columbia Encyclopedia, 2004. It is the smallest of the
shallow seas around the continental shelf of Europe, covering an area of some
